title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 17 August 2012 - XWiki
content:
00:02 <abusenius> has quit  
00:24 <CIA-117> Vincent Massol master \* re3bf00e https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/e3bf00e80d91b7c375a2d9d6a21d4d0cae7118e6 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-search/xwiki-platform-search-ui/src/main/resources/Main/LuceneSearch.xml : XWIKI-8146: Search RSS feed not having correct content type - http://git.io/jowNqw

00:30 <polx> has quit  
00:41 <vmassol> has quit  
02:21 <tekzilla> has quit  
03:36 <CIA-117> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* r937afc5 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/937afc51119e438994ea8af2c2e9770e6a6393ba / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-web/src/main/webapp/resources/uicomponents/widgets/upload.js : XWIKI-8132: New JS Widget for uploading files via XMLHttpRequest - http://git.io/FY3vfA  
03:36 <CIA-117> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* re9be29d https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/e9be29d1b4d013363c63070bfd29b02458a18679 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-web/src/main/webapp/resources/uicomponents/widgets/upload.js : XWIKI-8132: New JS Widget for uploading files via XMLHttpRequest - http://git.io/AAyI8g  
03:36 <CIA-117> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* r5c9b4e7 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/5c9b4e70879da79fb539b0c082359240ab6b0e04 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-web/src/main/webapp/resources/uicomponents/widgets/upload.js : XWIKI-8132: New JS Widget for uploading files via XMLHttpRequest - http://git.io/qQNODQ  
06:10 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
06:38 <polx> has quit  
06:48 <tekzilla> has joined #xwiki  
08:19 <coud> has joined #xwiki  
09:10 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
09:29 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
09:44 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
10:36 <vmassol> good morning, does anyone know how Classloading work for extensions?  
10:39 <@sdumitriu> Good morning  
10:40 <@sdumitriu> I guess Thomas is the only one that knows...  
10:40 <@sdumitriu> Which is bad  
10:40 <vmassol> yeah, I'm reading the code  
10:40 <vmassol> I'm trying to make jsrx (and other resource types) work with extensions  
10:40 <vmassol> at first I thought loading from the context classloader would be enough but it's not  
10:41 <vmassol> apparently the extension is added to         NamespaceURLClassLoader classLoader = this.jarExtensionClassLoader.getURLClassLoader(namespace, true);  
10:41 <vmassol> classLoader.addURL(getExtensionURL(localExtension));  
10:41 <vmassol> now I can use commons classloader to get that classloader  
10:41 <vmassol> I would have thought that using the context CL would have been nicer though  
10:41 <vmassol> that's strange that thomas didn't do this  
10:44 <vmassol> hmmm seems that CL is dropped when the job is finished, there must be more  
10:45 <vmassol> we do have a thread context CL: ThreadClassloaderExecutionContextInitializer  
10:46 <vmassol> it seems to be empty at runtime though  
10:47 <vmassol> {{groovy}}  
10:47 <vmassol> println Thread.currentThread().getContextClassLoader().getURLs()  
10:47 <vmassol> {{/groovy}}  
10:47 <vmassol> return an empty list  
10:54 <vmassol> hmm the following is also empty:  
10:54 <vmassol> {{groovy}}  
10:54 <vmassol> println services.get("component").getInstance(org.xwiki.classloader.ClassLoaderManager.class).getURLClassLoader(null, false).getURLs()  
10:54 <vmassol> {{/groovy}}  
10:54 <vmassol> ahah  
10:54 <vmassol> got it  
10:54 <vmassol> {{groovy}}  
10:54 <vmassol> println services.get("component").getInstance(org.xwiki.classloader.ClassLoaderManager.class).getURLClassLoader("wiki:xwiki", false).getURLs()  
10:54 <vmassol> {{/groovy}}  
11:00 <vmassol> I wonder how core code can see extension code...  
11:04 <vmassol> hmm with ThreadClassloaderExecutionContextInitializer we should get the same result by getting the context CL  
11:06 <vmassol> oh it works  
11:09 <vmassol> kind of  
11:10 <vmassol> ThreadClassloaderExecutionContextInitializer is called tens of times for a single request  
11:11 <vmassol> and everytime it overwrites the previous context CL  
11:11 <vmassol> so while initially the context CL is ok it gets overwritten at some point by a not good one  
11:27 <vmassol> ok I get it  
11:29 <vmassol> in script macros we use another CL to wrap the current context CL  
11:29 <vmassol> {{groovy}}  
11:29 <vmassol> println Thread.currentThread().getContextClassLoader().getParent().getURLs()  
11:29 <vmassol> {{/groovy}}  
11:29 <vmassol> will return the extension jars  
11:34 <coud> has quit  
11:34 <coud> has joined #xwiki  
11:38 <vmassol> sdumitriu: ok I was able to make jsrx work with resources brought by an extension. Will commit this soon  
11:39 <vmassol> it looks a bit slow though to get resources from a zip… something we will need to measure  
11:40 <vmassol> http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/jsx/Main/Main?resource=lib%2Fcodemirror.js takes several seconds to execute locally  
11:40 <@sdumitriu> Every time?  
11:40 <@sdumitriu> Or just the first time?  
11:40 <vmassol> every time  
11:40 <vmassol>     public long getLastModifiedDate()  
11:41 <vmassol>     {  
11:41 <vmassol>         // There is no easy way to know the last modification date of a resource file.  
11:41 <vmassol>         // return 0, which will make the action not set any Last-Modified date in the response.  
11:41 <vmassol>         return 0;  
11:41 <vmassol>     }  
11:41 <vmassol> isn't that the reason?  
11:41 <vmassol> (in SxResourceSource)  
11:43 <vmassol> actually I don't now, maybe the cache works  
11:43 <vmassol> right now I'm just opening http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/jsx/Main/Main?resource=lib/codemirror.js directly in my browser  
11:43 <vmassol> hmm that should be cached if it was working  
11:43 <vmassol> so it seems it's not working  
11:45 <jvdrean1> has joined #xwiki  
11:45 <jvdrean> has quit  
11:46 <Ana\_> has joined #xwiki  
11:46 <Ana\_> good day  
11:47 <vmassol> sdumitriu: the headers I get:  
11:47 <vmassol> Date  
11:47 <vmassol> Fri, 17 Aug 2012 09:43:03 GMT  
11:47 <vmassol> Content-Length  
11:47 <vmassol> 66891  
11:47 <vmassol> Server  
11:47 <vmassol> Jetty(7.4.5.v20110725)  
11:47 <vmassol> Content-Language  
11:47 <vmassol> en  
11:47 <vmassol> Cache-Control  
11:47 <vmassol> public  
11:47 <vmassol> Content-Type  
11:47 <vmassol> text/javascript; charset=UTF-8  
11:48 <vmassol> (for http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/jsx/Main/Main?resource=lib/codemirror.js )  
11:49 <vmassol> cache policy is default for SxResource  
11:50 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: This means that it should be cached (on the client) as long as you do normal navigation, not page refresh  
11:50 <@sdumitriu> But we should add some internal caching of the resources, true  
11:51 <@sdumitriu> I just didn't have time to implement it when I did the initial implementation, left it as a future improvement  
11:51 <@sdumitriu> Ana\_: Hello  
11:51 <vmassol> sdumitriu: indeed  
12:04 <Ana\_> sooo ... i'm in the process of adding the provided xar-file to my 4.1.3 installation and wondered if there was some kind of overview as to what features each containing thing offers  
12:04 <Ana\_> i've seen some documentation about the panels and kinda can figure out the meaning of sandbox and blog by myself, i guess  
12:05 <Ana\_> but to decide which features i want to install some more information would be welcomed  
12:05 <vmassol> Ana\_: you can see all XE features here: http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Features  
12:05 <Ana\_> thanks, i'll have a look there  
12:05 <Ana\_> and then be back to bother you some more  
12:05 <vmassol> then when you click on a link, for ex http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Invitation+Application, you'll see a box on the right that says Bundled With  
12:06 <vmassol> if it says "Bundled with XE" then you have it  
12:06 <vmassol> :)  
12:06 <vmassol> actually  
12:06 <vmassol> they're all bundled with XE since this pages only lists stuff bundled with XE by default ;)  
12:07 <vmassol> hmm need to find with the Logging app icon is wrong  
12:08 <vmassol> fixing  
12:41 <CIA-117> Vincent Massol master \* rc088e04 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-enterprise/commit/c088e04e114906452c8f226a3251e8e668274101 / pom.xml : XWIKI-8148: Add support for loading Skin Extension JS and CSS from JAR files - http://git.io/veUikA  
12:41 <CIA-117> Vincent Massol master \* r8a4958a https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/8a4958a0383e6cc1a6f112caca02b4e792ab5cad / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-classloader/xwiki-platform-classloader-xwiki/src/main/java/org/xwiki/classloader/xwiki/internal/ThreadClassloaderExecutionContextInitializer.java : [Misc] Added TODO - http://git.io/-GwSMA  
12:41 <CIA-117> Vincent Massol master \* rbdec6bc https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/bdec6bc0ff81cea72fb7977ad02a7e166e636e68 / (3 files in 2 dirs): XWIKI-8148: Add support for loading Skin Extension JS and CSS from JAR files - http://git.io/Hs96nQ  
13:19 <Ana\_> has quit  
13:46 <@sdumitriu> Ah, vmassol, there's a problem with the ci server  
13:47 <@sdumitriu> Apparently one of the repositories was down for a while (I think the java.net one), but instead of returning a 404 file, they just responded with a HTML file saying that the site is down  
13:47 <@sdumitriu> And the local repository is now full of HTML files posing as pom or jar files  
13:48 <@sdumitriu> [FATAL] Non-parseable POM /home/hudsonagent/.m2/repository/org/xwiki/platform/xwiki-platform-administration-test-pageobjects/4.1.3/xwiki-platform-administration-test-pageobjects-4.1.3.pom: end tag name </head> must be the same as start tag <meta> from line 7 (position: TEXT seen ...{\n\ttext-decoration: underline;\n\tcolor: #999999;\n}\n</style>\n</head>... @86:8)  @ line 86, column 8  
13:48 <vmassol> so we should just clean the nexus cache?  
13:49 <@sdumitriu> I don't know if that's enough  
13:49 <vmassol> they'll get redownloaded  
13:49 <@sdumitriu> First we have to check if that repo is still down or not  
13:49 <vmassol> is the problem fixed now?  
13:49 <@sdumitriu> Second, we need to clean the local repos on the agents as well  
13:49 <@sdumitriu> Checking  
13:50 <vmassol> the error you've pasted is for our own artifact so how could it be full of HTM?  
13:50 <@sdumitriu> Ah, it's the jboss.org repo  
13:51 <@sdumitriu> Because it tried to fetch it from each repo in turn, until it found it  
13:51 <@sdumitriu> And the jboss.org responded with a HTML instead of a "404 artifact not found"  
13:51 <@sdumitriu> And jboss.org comes before our own maven server  
13:51 <vmassol> ok I see  
13:52 <vmassol> I had seen the error but couldn't understand it...  
13:53 <vmassol> hmm I wonder why jboss has some xwiki paltform stuff: https://repository.jboss.org/nexus/content/groups/public/org/xwiki/platform/  
13:53 <@sdumitriu> OK, it seems to be up now: https://repository.jboss.org/  
13:53 <vmassol> they're empty but stil strange  
13:53 <vmassol> this too: https://repository.jboss.org/nexus/content/groups/public/org/xwiki/manager/  
13:54 <@sdumitriu> Not all of them are empty: https://repository.jboss.org/nexus/content/groups/public/org/xwiki/commons/xwiki-commons/4.1-rc-1/xwiki-commons-4.1-rc-1.pom  
13:54 <vmassol> yes that's normal  
13:54 <vmassol> those we release on maven central  
13:54 <vmassol> well not really "normal" since they shouldn't need to copy them  
13:55 <vmassol> maybe they proxy maven central  
13:55 <@sdumitriu> Can you clean our nexus?  
13:55 <vmassol> I can try  
13:55 <vmassol> I've just clicked "expire cahce" on public rpeos  
13:56 <vmassol> still working: http://nexus.xwiki.org/nexus/index.html#view-logs  
13:59 <@sdumitriu> Still broken: http://nexus.xwiki.org/nexus/service/local/repositories/jboss/content/org/xwiki/platform/xwiki-platform-administration-test-pageobjects/4.1.3/xwiki-platform-administration-test-pageobjects-4.1.3.pom  
13:59 <vmassol> it's not finished apparenty  
13:59 <@sdumitriu> Why is it taken from /local/repositories/jboss/content/ ?  
13:59 <vmassol> taking forever  
13:59 <vmassol> 2012-08-17 13:51:11 INFO  [pool-1-thread-8] - o.s.n.f.DefaultFeed~          - Expiring caches for repository Public Repositories from path / and below. : Process started on Fri Aug 17 13:51:11 CEST 2012, not yet finished.  
13:59 <vmassol> 2012-08-17 13:51:11 INFO  [pool-1-thread-8] - o.s.n.p.m.m.M2Repos~          - Expiring local cache in repository ID='releases' from path='/'  
14:00 <@sdumitriu> Ah, I think that we didn't have that artifact in 4.1.x  
14:00 <@sdumitriu> And maven fetched it when trying to compare the master (4.2) with the previous version  
14:01 <@sdumitriu> That's why we don't have it in our repos  
14:24 <@sdumitriu> vmassol: Still running? I can't see the logs on nexus, but the artifact is still broken  
14:25 <vmassol> I think we should restart nexus  
14:25 <vmassol> the last error I get in the logs is  
14:25 <vmassol> 2012-08-17 14:11:14 ERROR [-11860715-21066] - o.s.n.r.NexusApplic~          - Unhandled exception or error intercepted  
14:25 <vmassol> java.lang.OutOfMemoryError: Java heap space  
16:01 <pgmjsd> has quit  
16:01 <sdumitriu> has quit  
16:01 <pgmjsd> has joined #xwiki  
16:01 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
16:17 <ries> has quit  
16:59 <coud> Hi, I have problem using annotations. I followed FAQ tutorial and created application based on it. In resulting application I can add annotations to all class properties but annotations added to textarea are not highlighted. Here is screenshot: http://imageshack.us/photo/my-images/607/annotationproblem.png/  
17:02 <vmassol> coud: have you enabled annotations?  
17:02 <vmassol> you have  
17:02 <vmassol> (just checked the image)  
17:02 <vmassol> the screenshot looks ok, what's wrong?  
17:03 <vmassol> I think I know, the textarea is wrapped by an {{html}} macro so the annotation is added for the whole block  
17:04 <vmassol> I think this is a known limitation  
17:04 <coud> vmassol there should be "some text" highlighted in the "Use case text" section of the page  
17:04 <vmassol> let me test  
17:05 <vmassol> actually I can even make that worse…. :)  
17:05 <vmassol> I tested in the blog application, trying to annotate the content of a blog post  
17:06 <vmassol> (which is a textarea similar to your use case)  
17:06 <vmassol> and for me the whole textarea is not even displayed when there's an annotation ;)  
17:07 <vmassol> actually I get exactly this: http://jira.xwiki.org/jira/browse/XWIKI-6328  
17:07 <vmassol> so we currently have a limitation when annotating HTML content but I don't remember the details  
17:07 <vmassol> (anca is the one who coded this but she's not connected)  
17:08 <coud> vmassol thats bad.. :) I noticed this behavior (all text dissapeared) when I created application with "app withing minute" application.  
17:08 <vmassol> yes I agree it's bad  
17:10 <coud> ok, is there any workaround ? For example should I use some another data type or something ?  
17:11 <vmassol> yes there's a workaround  
17:11 <vmassol> let me try it first  
17:17 <vmassol> coud: ok it works  
17:17 <vmassol> so  
17:17 <vmassol> instead of writing:  
17:17 <vmassol> $doc.display("description")  
17:17 <vmassol> (for ex)  
17:17 <vmassol> you can write:  
17:17 <vmassol> #set ($obj = $doc.getObject("Test.TestClass"))  
17:17 <vmassol> $obj.getProperty("description").getValue()  
17:18 <vmassol> $doc.display() is the code that will add the {{html}} macro around the content  
17:18 <vmassol> so if you don't use that and instead directly put the textarea content you won't have any html macro and your annotation will work fine  
17:18 <vmassol> :)  
17:24 <coud> vmassol yes, it works! thank you! :)
